events.name: Hackerspace Talk: Pragmatic Approaches to Software Testing in Stripe
events.description:
Welcome to the first week of school! This Wednesday we have a talk from the lead iOS engineer in Stripe! Free pizzas after the talk :)

Talk Description:
In this talk, we'll discuss some pragmatic approaches to software testing: not just how to write better tests, but why you should care about writing tests in the first place. We'll discuss a few examples of testing improvements we've made in the Stripe iOS dashboard app, and save lots of time for Q&A at the end.

Speaker bio:
Jack Flintermann is an iOS engineer from New York City. He works at Stripe, building software tools for developers to easily accept payments in apps and on the web. He holds degrees in Biology and Computer Science from Brown University. You can see some of his work at jackflintermann.com.

events.name: Spring Boot 1.3 and JVM Optimisation night!
events.description:
Hi,first of all, all our best wishes for the new year! We're going to kickstart 2016 with an event on Spring Boot and JVM Optimization. == Sergi Almar - Spring Boot 1.3Sergi is a key person in the Spring ecosystem. He has been teaching Spring for over 5 years and is the organizer of the Spring.IO conference in Barcelona. He will be visiting Singapore next week to teach a class. On Wednesday he will be discussing the new features coming with Spring Boot 1.3 (Automatic Application restart, new auto-configurations...).  


== Dapeng Liu - JVM and Tomcat optimisation Dapeng works on a high scale environment with millions of requests every minute. He has worked a lot on performance in the past years and will share some of the most interesting optimisations he has worked on this year.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore
